text:
We are running a Windows 2000 Server with Apache version 1.3.12 that came 
bundled with Oracle 8i.

We know our apache server is old, but we are hesitant to upgrade it because 
there is no documentation to upgrade an apache installation that came bundled 
with oracle 8i.

here is our problem.

Whenever the client browser trys to access the ssl port/using the url of 
https://, rather than http://, when the apache service is running, apache will 
crash and give the following error, in the error_log file:



[Tue Dec 09 15:54:34 2003] [crit] (10038)An operation was attempted on 
something that is not a socket: Parent: WSADuplicateSocket failed for socket 
132.
[Tue Dec 09 15:54:34 2003] [error] (2)No such file or directory: master_main: 
create child process failed. Exiting.
[Tue Dec 09 15:55:34 2003] [error] forcing termination of child #0 (handle 820)


the apache service works fine if the client browser does not use the 
add "https" into the url, but we need it because we have a login page that we 
want to encrypt the username and passwords that our clients will be inputting


thank you

Phil Capiral
Eastern Washington University
Cheney, Washington
creator: philcapiral@hotmail.com

text:
I'm sorry, but this is not the place to resolve the problem :(

If Oracle supplies the Apache-based server, contact Oracle.  Note also that SSL
support for Apache-1.3 is not maintained here either, so beyond the ancient
release and not knowing exactly what Oracle supplies, your problem appears to be
in a component that we don't supply.

FWIW, Apache 2 includes mod_ssl for SSL support.
creator: trawick@apache.org
